body: I tried using `std::vector<IntList>` instead of `std::vector<std::vector<int64_t>>` and the values inside changes between the forward and backward passes (I'm not sure why)... In addition the ArrayRef source code https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/ATen/ArrayRef.h#L23-L33 comes with a warning to not use it for storage.
body_html: I tried using std::vector<IntList> instead of std::vector<std::vector<int64_t>> and the values inside changes between the forward and backward passes (I'm not sure why)... In addition the ArrayRef source code https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/ATen/ArrayRef.h#L23-L33 comes with a warning to not use it for storage.
body_text: I tried using std::vector<IntList> instead of std::vector<std::vector<int64_t>> and the values inside changes between the forward and backward passes (I'm not sure why)... In addition the ArrayRef source code https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/ATen/ArrayRef.h#L23-L33 comes with a warning to not use it for storage.
